Porch.Body:
You are standing on the porch outside the front door of the house.
The storm picks up in intensity as you stand there.
Better get inside before you catch a cold.

Intro.Body:
You are the only detective for small mountain town.
There has been a murder that you have been called upon to solve in a house that you are currently on your way to.

Radio.Body:
You turn on the radio and immediately hear a news person describing the weather.

...terrible winds!...record breaking rainfall!...stay indoors!~-

You interrupt the weather announcement by turning off the car.
You've arrived at the house.

Driving.Body:
You drive the rest of the way to the house in silence thinking about what you'll say to the family members who are inside.
Eventually your thoughts get interrupted by turning off the car.
You've arrived at the house.

Living Room.Body:
You are standing in the living room of the house.
In the center of the room on the coffee table is the unmistakable silhoutte of a body covered in a cloth.
From your debriefing you infer that this is the dead husband and father.
Spread out throughout the room, are four people:
The Wife, The Son, The Daughter, The Neighbor.
They are clearly distraught, best to locate evidence and bring closure to this case as quickly as possible.

Arresting.Body: Pick carefully who you will be arresting:

Husband.Body:
You carefully lift the cloth and inspect the body of the now deceased husband.
It is very obvious the cause of death is a large stab wound to the back of the neck.

Kitchen.Body:
The kitchen is a small room with a counter in the middle.
It feels like every kitchen you've seen, but as you make your way around the countertop, you notice something strange.
What seems like it would have been the largest knife in the knife block, is instead just an empty slot.

Basement.Body:
You enter the basement.
After a few minutes of exploring the space, you notice that the hatch that houses the breakers for the house is ajar.
Looking closer at the switches you see that the Attic light has been turned off.
You flip the Attic switch.

Upstairs.Body:
You stand in the hall at the top of the steps.
You can see multiple doors and a hatch at the end of the hall, leading to what you assume is the attic.

Attic.Body:
You enter the attic.
There is a small light dangling from the ceiling providing just enough light to see around in the cramped room.
As your eyes start to adjust, you see something shiny sitting on the ground in front of you.
You bend down to get a closer look and realize that it is a blood covered kitchen knife.
This is obviously the murder weapon.
You decide it is best not to pick it up as that may contaminate it as evidence.
You did it, you think to yourself.
You've found the most crucial piece of evidence towards solving this case.
You must be able to deduce from what you have seen so far who the culprit is.
You begin thinking back through what you have seen as you leave the attic.

Bathroom.Body:
You enter the bathroom.
You spend a few minutes looking for anything out of the ordinary, but find nothing.

Son's Bedroom.Body:
You enter the son's bedroom.
You spend a few minutes looking for anything out of the ordinary, but find nothing.

Daughter's Bedroom.Body:
You enter the daughter's bedroom.
You spend a few minutes looking for anything out of the ordinary, but find nothing.

Master Bedroom.Body:
You enter the master bedroom.
You spend a few minutes looking for anything out of the ordinary.
Eventually you get to inspecting the bed.
You decide to be extra thorough and lift the pillows.
Underneath is a shiny golden key with the word 'Basement' pressed into it.
What an odd place for this key. You remark as you slide it into your pocket for safekeeping.

Arrest Wife.Body:
After carefully considering the suspects you decide it must have been the Wife.
You inform everyone of this as you start reading them their rights and handcuffing them.

Arrest Son.Body:
After carefully considering the suspects you decide it must have been the Son.
You inform everyone of this as you start reading them their rights and handcuffing them.

Arrest Daughter.Body:
After carefully considering the suspects you decide it must have been the Daughter.
You inform everyone of this as you start reading them their rights and handcuffing them.

Arrest Neighbor.Body:
After carefully considering the suspects you decide it must have been the Neighbor.
You inform everyone of this as you start reading them their rights and handcuffing them.

Ending.Body:
You take them outside into the pouring rain and force them into the back seat of the car.
As you are doing this they are ferverently claiming innocence as they begin to choke up and you think you see a tear start to roll down their cheek as they grapple with the weight of what is happening.
You get into the drivers seat, and as you buckle yourself in, you look back at everyone with sad faces standing on the porch in the rain together.
As you start the car and begin to back out of the driveway, you think about how it all played out.
You pull onto the road and begin to accelerate contemplating whether there was any way you missed some detail that would have lead you to a different conclusion.
You can't be sure.
But one thing is for certain.
This is going to be a lot of paperwork.

THE END
